Sentencas: In this study, a proton conducting solid oxide fuel cell (layered H+-SOFC) is prepared by introducing a La(2)NiO(4)perovskite oxide with a Ruddlesden-Popper structure as a catalyst layer onto a conventional Ni + BaZr(0.4)Ceo(0.4)Y(0.2)O(3-delta) (NiO + BZCY4) anode for in situ CO2 dry reforming of methane.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst

Sentencas: The roles of the La2NiO4 catalyst layer on the reforming activity, coking tolerance, electrocatalytic activity and operational stability of the anodes are systematically studied.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst

Sentencas: The La2NiO4 catalyst layer exhibits greater catalytic performance than the NiO + BZCY4 anode during the CO2 dry reforming of methane.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst

Sentencas: An outstanding coking resistance capability is also demonstrated.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst

Sentencas: The layered H+-SOFC consumes H-2 produced in situ at the anode and delivers a much higher power output than the conventional cell with the NiO + BZCY4 anode.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst

Sentencas: The improved coking resistance of the layered H+-SOFC results in a steady output voltage of similar to 0.6 V under a constant current density of 200 mA cm(-2).
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst

Sentencas: In summary, the H+-SOFC with La2NiO4 perovskite oxide is a potential energy conversion device for CO2 conversion and utilization with cogeneration of electricity and syngas.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and syngas on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell with a perovskite layer as a precursor of a highly efficient reforming catalyst
